TopicTitle: 1.3.0 Coming Tomorrow! What are you excited for?

Articles.Content: I'm excited for the airbrakes and new engines.

[Redacted]

Edit:
I'm looking forward to seeing what progress they've made.  The real test is going to be when they release the science system, and we have a better idea where the game is headed.

Edit, Mk II:
V 0.1.3, not 1.3

Edited June 22, 2023 by razark
I'm not a nice person, so I decided to be better...
I too want to see the jump and whether it will be final step towards SCIENCE!  but this won't be known from the update, but rather the developer response to the feedback
Waiting to see if we will get a patch or if it will be pushed back. Then if we get said patch will it actually improve the game.

Candidate build 11507907 uploaded 3 days ago, uploaded to 'Staging' 10 hours ago, no turning back now.

Cold ones in the fridge, check.

Guacamole and Dorito's stand by

Leaving work 2 hours early this evening.

All my systems go for launch, let the countdown begin.

I'm looking forward to half the forum complaining and the other half swooning, and each half nitpicking everything the other half says.

And that one person posting the number of players every day. Can't wait for that.

12 minutes ago, Superfluous J said:

And that one person posting the number of players every day. Can't wait for that.

Whatever the number is, add one; because I can't play tomorrow.
Does anyone know what time the update is coming? @Vanamondedo you know?

Well I'm excited. After a major PC refresh I am no longer getting seconds per frame at launch so... lets do this. Bugs are gonna be bugs, early access is going to do early access things. If you believe anything differently you're just deluding yourself. Play the game, report bugs, wait for patch, rinse repeat until release. If that bothers you, shoulda waited till retail release to play.

2 hours ago, Astroneer08 said:

Does anyone know what time the update is coming? @Vanamondedo you know?

Moderators are player volunteers, not company staff. We rarely know anything players do not.

7 hours ago, Vanamonde said:

Moderators are player volunteers, not company staff. We rarely know anything players do not. 

The Mods just get stuck with cleaning up all the messes that result.

v1.3.0 means a full realease and 3 large updates.

Isn't this against TOS for Steam to offer a released game version as an Early Access?

On 6/21/2023 at 7:53 PM, razark said:

The real test is going to be when they release the science system, and we have a better idea where the game is headed.

Agreed.  I think the real test of this game will be when (or if) roadmap features are released.

2 hours ago, Jimbodiah said:

v1.3.0 means a full realease and 3 large updates.

Isn't this against TOS for Steam to offer a released game version as an Early Access?

It's v0.1.3.0 actually, and as you can see the game is not a fully released one.

The first number is for the full release, so it's 0 for now

The second is for milestone update, the ones on the roadmap, science will be v0.2.0.0

The third number is for patches

The fourth number is for hotfixes (no hotfix has been done so far)

On 6/22/2023 at 1:18 PM, Vanamonde said:

Moderators are player volunteers, not company staff. We rarely know anything players do not. 

Ok, thanks for clarifiying.
